Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.
RChen added naif_host_id and instrument dart.hga
Created by A.C.Raugh from information downloaded from the public DART mission website maintained by the Applied Physics Laboratory at Johns Hopkins University (JHU APL) on 2021-08-12.

Internal_Reference.comment: The LICIACube CubeSat will ride on the DART spacecraft to the Didymos system, then be released about 10 days prior to encounter to observe the impact and aftermath.

Instrument_Host.name: Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) Spacecraft
Instrument_Host.description: The DART spacecraft, funded through NASA'sPlanetary Defense Coordination Office, was designed as an impactor, with some technology demonstration elements. It carried no scientific instruments, although the DRACO navigation camera did return an image data set. The spacecraft measure about 1.8m x 1.9m x 2.6 and was fitted with two Roll Out Solar Arrays (ROSA) measuring 8.5m x 2.4m each. Launch mass of the DART spacecraft was 610kg. The DART spacecraft carried along the Italian Space Agency LICIACube as a ride-along mission, releasing the cubesat 15 days before impact so that it could observer and send images back to Earth independently of DART.
